intro: Leptocionium violaceum, commonly known as the violet starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leptocionium violaceum is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitats.
